website_summaries.verdict: At this price, you'll have a hard time finding a better-sounding, better-looking, or more easy-to-use microphone for your computer. Just don't expect the Blue Microphones Snowball to replace a studio's worth of recording gear.
pros: The Snowball is an extremely sturdy and stylish multipattern microphone that plugs directly into your computer's USB port with a minimum of fuss
cons: Beyond USB, the Snowball offers no other audio outputs or inputs, the recording mode switch isn't intuitively labeled, and no recording software is included

customer_reviews.title: The quality of sound is great.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of sound is great. As a teacher, I have been working on "flipping" my classroom by making instructional videos. Some of my students had complained that the quality of sound on my videos was low because I was just using the built-in mic on my laptop. I debated on whether getting a USB headset or the Blue Snowball. The microphone worked just as described, no drivers to install or special software. We decided to test it right out of the box and I am glad I made this choice.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Blue Customer Service ruined the Experience
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product a couple weeks ago and have since returned it. The brushed aluminum model stopped working within the week I bought it and I contacted blue support. After initially responding claiming they would "love to help me set up a warranty claim", they never responded after I sent in my information. I called them during their listed operating hours and nobody answered the phone. I left a message and was never called back. I opened a second ticket in order to get answers for the first ticket and never got a reply. I eventually just returned the microphone because it was not worth the hassle. Blue Microphones has the worst customer support I have ever experienced.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin G.

customer_reviews.title: USB format changed, product description not so much!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this is a great microphone but I will have to wait until I buy a different USB cable. All of the photos in the product description show a classic AB usb connection, but the snowball that arrived is mini-USB. I purchased a 10' cord ahead of time because I knew the mic would come with a stumpy little 3' cord (which it did) so now I have a useless 10' cable that I now need to return and no cable long enough to plug this thing in. GREAT. BLUE: update your product descriptions to avoid reviews like this!!
customer_reviews.author: LD Smith

customer_reviews.title: Unreal awesome mic!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a total newbie when it comes to creating videos, and I needed to improve the sound quality of the narration in my videos. After some research I bought this mic. Its was supposed to be a mid grade, but its works like a top grade product. Super easy to use, awesome sound quality. Now I do put my sound through noise reduction software afterwards, but I really don't have to. There isn't that much to clean as this mic records very clean sound in the first place. It was a game changer for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Great entry-level microphone for podcasting
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't have all of the bells and whistles as the Yeti, but it's a very good step down from it. As long as you don't need to the support for the different modes, then this is a great choice for a quiet environment. It does NOT have any noise cancellation, so that's on your environment and software to help you with.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas & Jessii

customer_reviews.title: FAIL
customer_reviews.text: The USB port on the back of the mic that I received is NOT the type shown in the picture. THIS IS IMPORTANT, PEOPLE. I ordered this along with what *should* have been the correct USB cable (based on the photo), and both mic and cable arrived well in time for my event. But, as the cable will not actually work with the version of the mic they shipped, I'll have to order a different one, and I'm not sure it'll get here in time. You have now put the success of our event at risk. PICTURING THE CORRECT PORT IS ESSENTIAL.
customer_reviews.author: Adam S

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Beginner Mic
customer_reviews.text: Pros: High quality! Easy to store with the small boxes in the large box it comes in. Sturdy extendable stand that also swivels. Strong cable. Really cute and beautiful design and finish (I purchased the aluminum one). Omnidirectional settings could be useful for musicians and conferences. Cons: Have to be pretty close to the mic, which could hurt your back depending on how you're sitting, so consider purchasing a boom arm, or adjusting your seat so that your mouth meets the mic. Could also pick up background noise, such as high-pitched bird chirping. Cable is two feet long. Do I Recommend: Definitely for beginners on a small budget who are thinking of doing videos or podcasts!
customer_reviews.author: cozymaus

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy for an amateur podcaster.
customer_reviews.text: If your looking to begin your own podcast or other various broadcasted show, and don't have the money or experience to buy a large and confusing setup of microphones and compressors; this is your life saver. The Blue Snowball, not the light version, is a perfect choice for a USB microphone. No additional power connectors required, and the microphone is self condensing with three separate modes. Now be warned, this microphone will pick up EVERYTHING, including the ticking of a clock in the background or a fan near you. You can adjust the sensitivity with the mode change, but for a podcaster you will require complete and utter silence to have a clean recording.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Martin

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT HAVE COMPATIBILITY WITH WINDOWS 10
customer_reviews.text: The microphone started to shut down my PC through the "Blue Screen of Death", which could permanently damage my entire system. I cannot play a game for more than a couple of minutes before the BSOD happens again. The error has no fix for me because I have tried everything. Now I'm stuck with a $70 mic I can't even use because I cannot return it now. You can find a cheaper and better mic somewhere else. DO NOT BUY THIS MICROPHONE IF YOU HAVE WINDOWS 10.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blue is falsely advertising these microphones!!!
customer_reviews.text: These microphones are great but somewhere along the last year or so, Blue quietly changed these microphones from the old printer cable they used to mini USB and it is AWFUL. The mini USB connection on the back comes loose and the cable is quite flimsy. I work in podcasting and multiple people I know have had the very same issue. Not only that, but Blue continues using the old makes as the listing picture. Absolutely misleading and awful.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Works great, wish it lasted longer :/
customer_reviews.text: This microphone has excellent sound quality for a budget mic. That being said i'm a little disappointed that this mic gave out before the one year mark due to the switch on the back going bad. Its very frustrating that applying varying pressure and wiggling the switch back and forth makes the sound cut in and out. opening the mic it seems it might have corroded slightly. might buy again or get a different mic.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent at best
customer_reviews.text: I like this mic. But on my Mac I need an adapter to connect to usb c and I’m not sure if that is the issue but it’s an Apple certified connector so it should be fine. I must plug into a specific USB port or the mic doesn’t function. At times it simply stops working and I need to fully disconnect it from all cables. Reset the the directional switch through all settings then plug it in again. It used to work perfect but this has started to be a regular occurrence after 5 months of use. Thinking of replacing for a better mic.
customer_reviews.author: Fuze

customer_reviews.title: Paying for the Branding, but works great.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 14 year old. He requested this microphone specifically and I can see why. First off, it's fun looking. The price was higher than I wanted to pay, but you only turn 14 once. The sound quality is produces is crisp and clear without picking up much surrounding noise. it comes with a tripod that stands and adjusts easily, but doesn't seem all that stable to me..a little top heavy. Overall it is a good microphone, probably just priced a little high d/t the branding.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Mortensen

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work great, picks up voice and the mechanical keyboard is tolerable with it for gaming. I have it in front of the keyboard so it doesn't quite pick up as much. I use setting #1, the others don't work as well for my setup. Seems better than the cheaper Ice snowball, as that one doesn't have that sound feature so it picks up more background.
customer_reviews.author: BadDownloads

customer_reviews.title: This is an AWESOME microphone! A colleague of mine had one that ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an AWESOME microphone! A colleague of mine had one that he bought 5 or so years ago and he said he paid $250. He is an instructional designer. I am new to that role and he would let me use his microphone to record the narration of courses I was learning to develop. I decided to spend the money to get my own. To my surprise, the exact microphone was less than $100! I am THRILLED with the cost and quality! It was delivered sooner than I expected, too! Thank you to all that helped me get this product so quickly and inexpensively!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alison S. Spurlock

customer_reviews.title: It's a great little mic
customer_reviews.text: It picks up sound really well. It interfaces with the computer easily. It has the option to change to either omni-directional or uni-directional. Voices are clear and concise. When paired with the shock mount and a pop filter, it's a great addition to any home studio. That being said, it won't compare to a $1,000+ ribbon mic. But seriously, 99% of people couldn't tell the difference anyway. Especially if you're also going to be mixing in other sounds or music. If you're just using it for podcasting or YouTube videos, it's more than adequate and better than most handheld or headset mics you'd find. Worlds better than a built-in mic on a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: J. Price

customer_reviews.title: Dissappointed - sent two back
customer_reviews.text: After having great success using my Blue Yeti I was excited to purchase the Snowball, but I must say, I'm very disappointed after ordering two and having to send both back. Both times everything seemed fine, red light, driver install...but the mic would not be recognized by Windows. Apparently, this is a known problem...making the mic useless. To make matters worse, the Snowball (both) caused my laptop to crash consistently. I'd get a blue screen of death before I could trouble-shoot and fiddle around. No thanks. I don't have any of this hassle with my Yeti. Snowball...not great IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Craine

customer_reviews.title: Really upped my D&D game
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 players in a regular D&D group. More people were added to the local group the room got louder and remote people had trouble hearing everything. This mic in omnidirectional mode picks up everyone clearly and even does a decent job at getting the background music. I had some initial issues using chrome on my mac and windows machines but both Safari and IE worked great, that may be in the manual but I'm an engineer and I don't read them. I should but I don't.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Davis

customer_reviews.title: Very good mic
customer_reviews.text: Got this a few years back and it has stayed strong with me ever since. For the price, it’s a really good mic. Don’t expect professional sound but it’s pretty darn close. Sound quality is great, the stand has rubber nubs on the legs so that it can stay in place and the shell is also durable so it can take a couple bumps and drops. Overall, a very good mic and it’s something I definitely recommend buying
customer_reviews.author: TheHuskyK9

customer_reviews.title: Snowball mic
customer_reviews.text: I bought the white one. Easy to use. Good quality and a necessary tool if speaking in a video or hosting online Zoom or teaching a class. Much clearer than the built in mic of iPad Pro or the headset mic. Worth the cost and is reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Insufficient volume
customer_reviews.text: I tried this out to solve a problem with our gaming setup (we use Discord). I was hoping it would be better than the laptop's built in microphone. Well, it solved one problem: using this mic kept the keyboard noise from being audible to remote players (I was typing a running log of the game into a Word window). BUT this mic is somewhere between 10dB and 20dB less sensitive than the laptop's built-in mic.
customer_reviews.author: Barry D. Gold

customer_reviews.title: Overall Good Mic
customer_reviews.text: Overall this mic is pretty good. Sound quality is good and it is easy to setup. I have it on a boom arm and it works well. My only concern is that some of the settings do not deliver the best sound with certain voice apps like discord.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary B.

customer_reviews.title: Sent me a mic with a faulty port
customer_reviews.text: These microphones have a great reputation and I have been quite happy with ones I bought in the past. But I got a faulty one from here so I will be buying my replacement from someone else. Waited forever for a replacement cord to see if that was the issue, but since it's the microphone port directly, this was overall a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: S Coker

customer_reviews.title: A mic that'll last you a while with crisp audio.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this microphone for years and still to this day has the same quality as it did out of the box day one. The Brushed aluminum definitely gets dirty if you don't have a pop-filter. You may need to mess with the settings of the microphone a bit because it does hear everything in the room and then some. Nothing a little gain can't fix though. Beware if you have a loud keyboard though, because everyone on skype/discord will hear that, no matter what settings you have. Overall a 5/5, a great budget microphone that will last you years if you want something a tier higher than headset microphones but don't want to break the bank on voice communication.
customer_reviews.author: Juan M Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Not for conference calls / team standups
customer_reviews.text: We got this microphone to do team standup in front of the computer for remote folks and it works poorly for this role. It does not pickup sounds from very far, even in omni-directional setting. Combined with aggressive noise cancellation software (not the fault of the microphone itself) which cuts off everything with low gain, it is not much better than a standard laptop mic. When holding it in front of a person, the sound is fine. For group conference calls where people stand at 3-5 ft distance - big disappointment. We are thinking of trying Yeti instead.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandroid

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and sweet
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease of switching between sound setting; The size and weight of the microphone size and weight of the microphone are perfect. This is a beautiful & stylish multi dynamic microphone. The sound quality is great for podcasting, Vlogging, Creating videos and recording my sound therapy music. The Ringer shock mounting gives it a few added inches 💗
customer_reviews.author: Innocence Smith

customer_reviews.title: No Regrets!
customer_reviews.text: This is one high quality condenser microphone. I have used this multiple times when I need a voice over in my videos. If you have a limited amount of funds, this mic is for you. you can switch between 3 modes which determine where the mic picks up the audio. The nice thing about this mic is that it works with almost any program. I mostly use garageband,which comes free with every Macintosh Computer. I strongly suggest that you buy a pop filter and attach it to the rod of the microphone stand. Honestly, most any pop filter will do the job. Especially if it isn't for professional use.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary M.

customer_reviews.title: Multiple orders, these seem to be used
customer_reviews.text: The Snow Ball works fine, seems to be a good mic but it appears buying new, fulfilled by Amazon are all used. I've had two now, one had the wrong color in the box and was clearly used with lots of little scratches on the mic. The replacement had the correct Snow Ball but it too had bee opened and even had thread marks on the bottom connector. I think these are all refurbs being sold as new.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Williams

customer_reviews.title: Solid performer for the money, but not the best out there
customer_reviews.text: Solid microphone for voice chat, meetings and lightweight recording. I use this mic for all of the above, and am pretty satisfied with the performance. Yes, there are better microphones out there, particularly if you want a full recording setup, but these are an excellent bang for your buck. For the money spent, this is probably the best plug and play microphone setup you can get.
customer_reviews.author: J. Poyourow

customer_reviews.title: Design is flawed
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice. Not too clear on the sound quality, since I do not notice a big difference using this instead of the microphone on my digital webcam. The biggest complain I have is on the leg supporting the microphone. It is not steady, and when I tried to extend the "stem" that supports the "snowball", it always falls, which makes it useful for someone who have a longer upper body. This has to be fixed, and it's not expensive to fix.
customer_reviews.author: Sean C.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for doing voice overs on videos etc. Sound quality seems to be great. It was a little bigger than I expected but that is not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Muck Isl

customer_reviews.title: Best mic at this price level, great capture quality
customer_reviews.text: I have been debating on whether it was worth getting a separate microphone and headphones vs using a headset during my gaming on pc, I am glad I made this choice. The audio quality that this mic captures is fantastic for as much as I use it. In my opinion it is the best entry level mic at this price. If you are using casually and don't need on a professional level (which you would end up getting a more expensive product) this is what you should get! On top of the mic, I would also recommend a pop filter to better eliminate the "pop" of "b's" "p's" etc.
customer_reviews.author: Noe Lara

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for someone looking for better audio quality minus the steep costs typically associated with quality microphones.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little microphone for those who want better quality without paying a fortune out-of-pocket. A few times I had friends telling me I sounded a little "off" while in a skype call, but I was able to fix the issue by using a pop filter and bringing the mic closer to my face. I was so used to the mics attached to gaming headsets that I didn't realize that I had to keep this mic fairly close to my face, and also facing me, as the Blue's default is cardioid if I'm not mistaken, which essentially means that the mic will only pick up audio directly in front of it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Good desktop mic for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Works fine as a desktop microphone for gaming. In that role you can skip the pop filter if you want, though it certainly wouldn't do any harm to add one. The tripod mount is nice, but for my desktop setup I need the mic to sit a little bit lower than the mount allows. Fortunately the height-adjustment portion of the mount is removable, and removing it shaves a few inches off the overall height. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Beware sending cheaper model 'ICE' instead of highest quality original snowball
customer_reviews.text: Testimonials say that they received the cheaper model snowball called ICE instead of the high quality snowball original. That is a $20 price loss. This happened to me too. I guess they think most people will not notice
customer_reviews.author: Jason E

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected, not for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Astonishing great quality for IRL or podcasting, but definitely not something you want to use for gaming...also, great for recording clean guitar riffs and vocals
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Tick, Tick, Tick, Tick???????
customer_reviews.text: WTH? I plugged it in and tried a test of my voice, I heard my voice but there was this very fast/loud ticking sound right along with my voice, sounded like a machine gun in the background, only much too loud to be in the background! Get real, this goes back where it came from! Yesterday! T.W. Anderson {:^(-{{{----[
customer_reviews.author: TWA

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great quality mic for the price point. It is much bigger than it looks though, most people will not use all 3 functions of the mic but I thought the few extra dollars would be worth the option plus the mic stand is better quality and a little taller than the iCE version. The only con I can see about this mic is that it does not have a mute option on it. If you are looking for a higher end mic I prefer the Blue Yeti, for my purposes it isn't worth another $70+.
customer_reviews.author: Calajane

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and works well - but test it as soon as you get it to make sure it works!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Snowball Mic - well, once I received a good one. The first mic had a loud hum noise that was almost as loud as my voice. I tried it on multiple computers from multiple locations before deciding it was defective. The second mic works perfectly, but the chrome 'Blue' logo was detached and flopping around in the box. The mic worked so good I decided to not risk getting another bad one and used superglue to reaffix the emblem. I've been using it for months and it works great! Helpful tip: buy a pop filter for best results.
customer_reviews.author: KevCentral

customer_reviews.title: Great microphone if you're on a budget!
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this microphone back in 2013 for better sound quality in video production and general use such as Skype calls and in-game chat. One problem I ran into was that the bulky size tended to get in the way a surprising amount so having some sort of swing arm for it would be ideal. A HUGE plus about this little guy is the fact that it's pretty much built "like a tank" sorta speak-- I've dropped this thing off my desk plenty of times and it didn't hurt it one bit (aside from cosmetic; scratches and dents). So in short, I would recommended this microphone to anyone who is on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: MaskedFey

customer_reviews.title: great for gaming
customer_reviews.text: As a gamer who has gone through multiple headsets (earphone+mic combos) I decided it was about time to have them set up separately. Great little mic, just plug it in and use it, it has 3 settings on the back of the mic depending on what you're using it for. It comes with its own stand and sits perfectly on my desk. The vocal range is larger than I expected, I have this set up on the far edge of my desk but I can still be heard perfectly when I speak. Not cheap but not too expensive IMO, well worth your money.
customer_reviews.author: amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, using it for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good, using it for gaming. Isn't so great next to a mechanical keyboard, and only the front direction seems to pick up the best audio quality. For being an orb shaped mic I would of liked to be able to tilt it up/down with the stock stand so I could put it above me and point it down - but the included stand sits perfectly level on a not-so-perfectly level/spacious environment on my end. Quality is really solid, picks up EVERYTHING. I'm not using a pop-filter or using this professionally, but if you need to be heard and you'd rather wear wireless headphones/quality headphones I'd say this is a good run for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Madary Jr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect First Mic
customer_reviews.text: My first microphone, and I'm wondering why I never invested in the Blue Snowball before. As an educator, I've been screencasting lessons or training videos for the past three years, and I didn't realize that there would be such a difference between an external mic (Snowball) and the computer's! I'm sure I can spend hundreds (thousands?) more on higher end equipment, but I'm a beginner and I think this mic at under $100 is a great buy for a novice like me. It's easy to use, makes me sound "professional" and is transportable. Very happy! (NOTE: There are two snowballs: One is called Snowball Ice, which I almost bought but opted for this instead based on reviews for both Snowballs.)
customer_reviews.author: Miriam & Taylor Prell

customer_reviews.title: Mic is fine, stand is not
customer_reviews.text: The microphone part works fine. The build of this is a different situation. The stand that it's on is lightweight plastic and idk what's happening in there, but no matter how much I try to tighten it, the ball rotates with the slightly pull of the usb cord, so I have to end up methodically place the wire so the mic stays facing me.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Only for speaking directly into it
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost, only buy this if you intend to record with your mouth directly next to the mic. Otherwise, it picks up background sound terribly. I bought this intending to upgrade from using my webcam mic, a Logitech C525 mic that's 3 years old. The webcam mic is probably 10x louder compared to this Blue mic when less then 2 feet away on my desk. I played with settings forever, and it honestly sounded terrible regardless. The ONLY way this will sound incredible is if you are speaking directly into it. Period. Otherwise it will be quiet and filled with background distortion. This is a specific use mic. The quality is A+ if your mouth is next to it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebeca

customer_reviews.title: Used and broken
customer_reviews.text: The unit I received was not only used but it was faulty. The switch on the back to change microphone patterns was broken and would cause the mic not to pick up sound after being flipped. Edit: I received my replacement microphone yesterday and it works very well. For the cost this seems to be a good microphone for speaking and audio conferencing.
customer_reviews.author: Zefinator

customer_reviews.title: BEST purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love using this microphone for recording my online lessons. The clarity and white noise reduction enhancements really allows for my students to hear my voice clearly. This product has been a life saver in this distant and remote learning world. I highly recommend this microphone to any teacher or entrepreneur. It will help you tremendously!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Carson

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at the end of January and I loved it. Great quality, the sound was great, I had zero complaints. It was easy to use as well. Fast Forward three months and all of a sudden it has terrible feedback. I tried recording multiple times and could barley hear what was recording because the feedback was too loud. Great product but it doesnt seem to last very long
customer_reviews.author: Amiel

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Mic For YouTube
customer_reviews.text: Great starter mic for YouTube. It picks up my voice well, but can sometimes sound quiet on it's own. I tend to either apply a compressor after recording, or I use a virtual audio mixer like Voicemeetr to boost the input signal. There's 3 settings 1st is perfect for podcasts or vocal recordings. 2 applies a -10 dB pad for if you need speak loudly or closer to the mic, and 3 is omnidirectional for interviews or room recordings. All in all a fantastic mic! I suggest getting a suspension arm stand for more versatility
customer_reviews.author: Lo Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Great Mic
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my youngest son. He researched many different models until he found this model. It met his expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Donutman

customer_reviews.title: unusable for a table of people
customer_reviews.text: I tried and tried to get this microphone to pick up all the voices sitting around a table, but the gain or sensitivity on it was so low that I could never get it to clearly record the voices. My cheap webcam microphone does a much better job, so I returned the Snowball.
customer_reviews.author: CAMP Grover

customer_reviews.title: Great mic
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality mic, it has 3 settings which help to either catch more ambient sounds, or limit the the range to just right in front of the mic. ...I get complements all the time in games from people telling me how sexy my voice is, and that I should be a radio host; this literally happens to me multiple times a week!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Bergfield

customer_reviews.title: Great USB Mic for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: Amazing USB microphone for the value. Great for beginners. Plug and play, no software installation required. I've had mine since 2009 and it still works perfectly to this day. Check out my video for the full review! I do tech reviews on YouTube if you're interested in subscribing :)
customer_reviews.author: Andy Slye

customer_reviews.title: Rated E for Everyone
customer_reviews.text: I've been a Blue Microphone user for years now, though in the past year I switched from the Snowball to the Yeti. Still, my time with the Blue Snowball was a good one. I never had connectivity issues or any kind of technical issues as a result of the Snowball, and given how much cheaper Snowballs are than when I had bought mine, I would highly recommend one to any person starting out in their career using microphones. Be you a podcaster, a singer, a musician, or a youtuber, this a mic for you.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Martin

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS MIC!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a YouTuber that does video game let's plays and tutorials. I use this microphone daily! I've had it for a year now and don't know where I would've been without it. it's audio is exceptional for the price. When I started I chose a much more difficult route of recording my party chat. I know how to record party and my audio in a much simpler method now but refuse to because it would require me to give up this mic. I just can't find anything with as good of audio quality within that price range. I hands down recommend this for anyone starting a career in youtube!
customer_reviews.author: Scoot

customer_reviews.title: Great little mic
customer_reviews.text: I chose this model over the cheaper ice model because it has 3 different modes for the situation you're using the mic in. Anyway its a nice mic and picks up everything in the room if you want or just a small area. The stand that came with it is pretty good and has adjustments for height. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: The quality is fantastic but, I think due to its attempt to be useful for more than one setting, the microphone picks up an awful lot of background noise. My apartment isn't ideal for podcast recording so that may be expected, but after some EQ the quality is good enough. I don't have enough experience with other mics to determine if this is due to the microphone itself or the environment. However, it records very crisp audio and I know that many other YouTube channels and podcasters start out with this very same unit.
customer_reviews.author: Harlequin Grim

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a year and a a half...
customer_reviews.text: The snowball mic was great while it worked. Unfortunately, after about a year and a half, it just randomly got really really quiet. I've tried messing with my software settings, re installing drivers, restarting many times, etc... this is very dissapointing for a $60 mic.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Excellent microphone
customer_reviews.text: Best mic i have used. The cardiod is exellent. I live in a noisy environment and it cancels everything and only picks up what is directly in front of. So it definitely does what its supposed to do. The quality of sound that is produced from it is excellent as well. I am a person who just needs quick recording with no audio editing. With this mic no editing really needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben ayala

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for buck for the last 5 years.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in 2014 and used religiously since then. After 5 years the only issue is a weird crackling that appeared recently. Unfortunately this makes it almost unusable when it starts acting up. But 5 years of continuous use is a great plus for this product in my eyes with phenomenal audio quality and wholly reliable plug and play. Going to try the Blue Yeti now.
customer_reviews.author: Shadi

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product
customer_reviews.text: Buy this as a present for my niece for her birthday. I told her to make a Youtube video and use this to record all her singing, she loves it and keeps using this microphone ever since. Good quality product, although I think it's not for a professional singer but it's good for a starter :) If you look for a mid-price range Microphone for your little one or your nephew or niece, I think this is the right one.
customer_reviews.author: Jwen_rtk

customer_reviews.title: Used daily and it never fails
customer_reviews.text: i use my Blue Snowball every day. Its used for meetings, recordings and even some live streaming and it is rock solid. Excellent sound quality and has improved not only my meeting quality audio but also my live streaming. My only ask is that if it had a way to configure the noise cancelling as the defaults work but they could be better so a driver that would allow me to tweak the noise cancelling would greatly help
customer_reviews.author: William Finn

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I've been very impressed with this as a part-time musician. When I record or play for people via the microphone the feedback I'm given is it sounds very professional and very clear. On many occasions I've been asked if I do podcasts or youtube videos. I haven't done any loud recordings yet but on the first setting my acoustic picks up very well with a good range. I'll be trying it out with my half-stack at volume on the various settings to try that out soon, but for the time I've had it I would recommend it as an easy buy.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Great microphone for uncomplicated podcast setup
customer_reviews.text: This microphone does exactly the job I bought it for, a rinky-dink podcast operation. I'm totally new to podcast game but being able to to plug right into my Mac and connect to Garageband. There are so many settings to play with in the software, but the mic delivers. If I was going to get more complicated with more than two people talking, I might go with a different setup altogether, but this is great for me. Took me a few days to realize the ball head actually pivots. Don't be like me!
customer_reviews.author: Munchguy

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I owned one of these several years ago and really liked it. The sound is really good. No echo as if you were talking into a tin can. Really clear. It's nice that they have 3 settings on the back so you can choose which one works best for your recording situation. I use Audacity and Obs. Great recording.
customer_reviews.author: Trina Helton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound recordings with the Snowball
customer_reviews.text: First of all, this mic does NOT look like the picture. It is glossy and shiny, not the matte, brushed aluminum I expected. I called the company, thinking my mic was in a mis-marked box, and they said only the white snowball has a matte finish - ALL the other colors have a gloss finish. I think they should include this information in their descriptions. I have the Snowball Universal Pop Filter attached to my mic which hides part of the reflective surface. The tripod legs are sturdy. As a mic, it performs superbly. I've only used it for voice narration recordings, which have been even and smooth, with excellent sound quality. Amazing value for the price. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: A.A. Norman, Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: Very Good microphone, but could be improved
customer_reviews.text: This microphone is working out very well with my Dragon NaturallySpeaking software. I have a ticking clock behind it and a furnace in the next room, neither noise maker is being picked up by this microphone, effecting the software. I am speaking a bit over normal voice with the mic aimed right at me. the mic can easily be turned from side to side, but can not be adjusted up and down. So, I put the two front legs on a book while the back leg sits on the desk, giving the mic an upward pitch toward my face. Overall I would really recommend the Snowball ICE microphone, at least for voice recognition software use.
customer_reviews.author: B. Positive

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for recording your Audiobook...and such!
customer_reviews.text: This is worth it! I bought a cheaper but well rated mic and I had all kinds of background noise/tone. It was in the dialogue as well. I used Audacity to clear it up, but that only worked on the background noise. My dialogue was still not crisp no matter what I did with levels and external buffering tricks (pop screens, padding, etc.) I finally caved in and purchased this. IMMEDIATELY all that external garbage was gone that I got with the other mic and I haven't even added my pop screen etc. I'm recording an audio book and this is def worth the money to save you time and frustration with having to remove feedback/tone noise afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Standalone Microphone for Life
customer_reviews.text: I had been using this for more than 8 years and it still works today! I have not had a single drop in deterioration of audio quality for using this microphone and I'm glad to use it as my go-to option whenever I'm not using headphones. The only con is that the microphone's stand is less durable, but can still keep the microphone in an upright position. Other than that, if you're looking for a good quality standalone microphone, then this product is worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for studio quality ...
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my prize possessions. I am loving using my Blue Mic. I have recorded a few spiritual songs using this mic as well as a few songs i written for my lovely wife. Quality is top notch and comparable to the more higher end expensive USB mic costing up in the $200-$300 range. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for studio quality recording or just pod casting. Excellent product that I have been using for a while now and I haven't ran into any problems.
customer_reviews.author: AlexDavis1974

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Microphone!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Condensing Microphone! The Brand "Blue" has years of microphone producing, and it shines through. I ordered the Brushed Aluminium, and it came looking absolutely amazing! The bad thing is that it really likes to collect fingerprints. The stand is made of plastic, but it is solid. It is adjustable to about 4 inches taller. It comes with a 6 foot, long plastic, coated braided cable. The chrome on the stand stands out nicely against the black parts. I have had the microphone for about a year now, and it still sounds Good as new! Would recommend this microphone for a starting youtuber, or anyone looking for a nice budget microphone
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overrated
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this mic. I found much better dynamic microphones for the money after having to replace this after a year. Don't take my word for it just do some research before buying blue.
customer_reviews.author: Derek S.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I'm just starting in the field of singing and recording it, and the Snowball has been a real life saver. The sound quality is amazing and though I struggle to get it to cooperate with Cubase (that's Cubase's fault) it's all worth it. Great quality, and cheaper than anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Michi

customer_reviews.title: Great quality microphone from a trusted audio brand. Size can present an issue.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this microphone for six and a half years. It's never failed me in that entire time. The quality has been fantastic for gaming, voice communication both personal and business, and live streaming. Great for people wanting to ease into podcasting or other vocal productions. The only real downside is the size but a microphone arm or stand could potentially solve that if it's an issue for you. I did have issues with the rear port for the wire becoming loose. Unsure if it was my own mistake over the years or if it was just due to natural wear. It caused the wire to potentially fall out if moved too much.
customer_reviews.author: Tori LaC

customer_reviews.title: Great mic for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great sound capturing for sucha great price! I have done several recordings so far and it seems to be flawless. Connects and sets up easy. Highly recommend for anyone doing voice work or singing. Has different settings for ambient and instrument recording as well.
customer_reviews.author: Knightling

customer_reviews.title: this was a great purchase and will very likely order another when my ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I'm leaving this review late. The microphone still works after a couple of years (even after a few nasty falls and rough handling here and there)! The only problem is the plug sometimes fits in the microphone upside down, but once you figure out that issue everything is golden. My laptop and desktop occasionally would not recognize it and I would have to keep plugging and unplugging the usb cord until it eventually picked it up. I don't think that's an issue with the microphone but the software I was using. Either way, this was a great purchase and will very likely order another when my current one bites the dust.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Great for LPs and streaming.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality for the price. I upgraded to this from my old $20 headset and the difference is night and day. It's a fantastic mic for the aspiring let's player or streamer. Bear in mind that it's rather sensitive and you should turn off anything that may cause background noise before recording something. I've been using it for about two years and haven't seen any reason to upgrade to the several-hundred-dollar models, so I think this is your best bet. For what it's worth, it looks rather nice too, so it could make a fine addition to one's gaming or streaming setup.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan F

customer_reviews.title: Regretted the color when I saw it and it came scratched.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the black because I thought it would match my TV and PS4, however they fail to mention that the wire comes white regardless. It also came scratched so with black the scratches show much more. The sound is amazing, though, so I'll give it four stars. However, after turning off the PS4 with it plugged in then turning it back on, the mic no longer works. I tried unplugging and replugging with still no success. I tried shutting it off then back on with and without it being plugged in and it still doesn't want to work. Keep that in mind if you want to use one on the PS4.
customer_reviews.author: David Crouse

customer_reviews.title: Finally a quality mic
customer_reviews.text: Kept buying cheap mics because my kids kept breaking them. Finally decided to purchase a quality mic, and I am so happy I did. This is really high quality and I feel like it will really last. There are not the same flimsy parts to break like on all the other mics I bought. Comes with a nice sturdy stand. Only compliant is the stand as to be screwed tight so the mic will not rotate and I have to retighten it frequently, but that is not a big deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bismillah

customer_reviews.title: Bought two, one is great, the other is not.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two... one works great, has really great sound! the second.... well, it is corrupt out of the box, and after 3 hours of troubleshooting, youtube forums, and driver shenanigans, I'm exchanging it. not my favorite thing to do with a new piece of gear, but i know there's always factory errors that can happen.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: ... beauty for several months now and she still works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this little beauty for several months now and she still works like a charm. Everything from recording music, to normal talking, to singing, heck I even use this thing when communicating to fellow gamers. If you're looking for any microphone for really any recording purposes this is an excellent choice to start off with. If you really want to know how well this product works, head over to youtube and search for it, most vids featuring this mic will be actually using the mic itself to record the audio in the vid. Very good product and again highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: JayMcJonesy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy for an amateur podcaster.
customer_reviews.text: If your looking to begin your own podcast or other various broadcasted show, and don't have the money or experience to buy a large and confusing setup of microphones and compressors; this is your life saver. The Blue Snowball, not the light version, is a perfect choice for a USB microphone. No additional power connectors required, and the microphone is self condensing with three separate modes. Now be warned, this microphone will pick up EVERYTHING, including the ticking of a clock in the background or a fan near you. You can adjust the sensitivity with the mode change, but for a podcaster you will require complete and utter silence to have a clean recording.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Martin

customer_reviews.title: Quality, Style, Ease of Use
customer_reviews.text: This excellent microphone is in the "Blue" tradition of style, quality and ease-of-use. It is the size of a softball and makes a fine statement on any desk. As a USB microphone, it operates as plug-and-play. (You may have to adjust some volume settings inside Windows to tune it to your system.) I bought it to improve the accuracy of Dragon Speech Recognition software. It worked well enough that I will purchase another Snowball--or a Blue Yeti -- and continue using Dragon. I had a tiny issue and emailed customer service. I experienced excellent support.
customer_reviews.author: Onomas

customer_reviews.title: Blue for the win.
customer_reviews.text: Several of my friends have used Blue microphones so i thought i would give it a try. This Microphone is very nice. The mice portion is a little bigger than i thought, the picture does not do it justice. The audio quality if very nice, plus there is a switch on the back that allows you to adjust the dB range. I intend to use this mic to my podcasting and commentary, wondering if it will be able to mount to my existing tripod that i used to hold my old mic. The audio quality is pretty crisp and is the perfect price for anyone looking for a good middle of the road microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: old technology
customer_reviews.text: This is old technology. The microphone picks up everything. You have to find the perfect distance to speak from. I actually bought a pop filter, and then couldn't hear anything. Look at the newer cheaper microphones.
customer_reviews.author: Forever Neil

customer_reviews.title: Great Microphone, even at Full Price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this microphone for use while streaming video as well as VOIP and it performs amazingly in that capacity. It easily picks me up from across the room. I've had problems in the past with headset mics having feedback on my system, but this mic worked flawlessly out of the box. The sound is perfectly clear. It can pick up sounds happening in the background, such as a fan, but I've found that happens only on setting 1 and switching to setting 2 completely removed the background sounds. This is a fantastic microphone, even at full price.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth it for the price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound quality with different switches to change to different parts of the microphone. Granted, I've only rated it 4 stars instead of 5 because Cardioid, the switches you'll be using the most often are 1 and 2, while the 3rd switch is made mostly for conference pick up, picking up from all sides for the microphone, which is a good option but will not be used often. Either way, this is a great microphone that is absolutely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Lora Mejia

customer_reviews.title: My son likes it...
customer_reviews.text: He uses it for recording voice and guitar, for school projects that involve videos, and as his gaming microphone for Minecraft. A very usable and serviceable microphone, useful for vocal or instrumental work, and adaptable to different situations with the voicing switch on the back. Nice little tripod, too. The photos make it look like it's a better match, aesthetically, for Apple MacBooks than it actually is. Its version of 'brushed aluminum' is a little shinier than the Apple version, and doesn't really 'match'. So don't make your decision as to color on that basis. We might have gone with black or white, had we realized that. Good USB mic, regardless.
customer_reviews.author: Klaus Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great mic that works on Linux too
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this microphone. I do shoutcasting for video games and music recording for several people and this microphone excells in both. It's quite a bit larger than I expected, but it's still small enough to fit in a smallish bag. The stand it comes with is nice, and it's great having it be a USB mic so I don't need a separate power cable, since it is a condensers mic. The sound quality is just unbelievable, and it works really well on my Linux system.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Perce

customer_reviews.title: It is good, but it is expected to last longer.
customer_reviews.text: I used it for 4 months, and after that it started making strange noises when it moved a little or just and touched the air. It used to sound good, but it didn't last.
customer_reviews.author: Montesko

customer_reviews.title: Great microphone at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great microphone at a great price! You can really hear the difference of the great quality. Sure there's always more expensive ones out there but this is still an awesome mic. The only reason I gave it 4 stars was that I wish it would have an on/off button instead of having to plug in the USB cord in and out. It stays on if you don't while your computer is on. I use mine for video narration, Skype and since I'm part of a YouTube gaming channel, I use it also for pod casting, Definitely give this one a try!
customer_reviews.author: The Mix

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my daugher as a Christmas gift, but I think I've used it more while working from home when I attend meetings that have a VoIP (e.g. audio over my computer rather than a phone). Great sound quality and exclusion of other sounds in the room. My only beef is that the included stand makes it a bit top-heavy and I've knocked it over a couple times. (But that's easily accounted for by my klutzy nature too.)
customer_reviews.author: Dan Linder

customer_reviews.title: My Samsung galaxy S8 does a better Job. Also
customer_reviews.text: Ok for voice only. Recording a guitar I couldn't get a decent sound without noise. My Samsung galaxy S8 does a better Job. Also, it has absolutely no lateral sound isolation. Overall a poor product.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: for the price I do that think there's anything better to be
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect when I ordered this mic, it was beyond my expectations. Aesthetically, the plastic it's made of isn't quite the quality I wanted it to be, but it doesn't look cheap either, for the price I dont think there's anything better to be honest
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Elias

customer_reviews.title: Has never worked for me.
customer_reviews.text: I've never gotten it to work. It does record, but at a very low unsatisfactory level. It is larger than I thought; about the size of a softball.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great Microphone
customer_reviews.text: I have had this microphone for the better part of a year now, and it continues to be *awesome*. I use this to record, among other things, Audible audiobooks, and it works perfectly for that purpose. I have also recorded some music with it (guitar and voice) and found it to be great for that as well. The sound is clear, clear, clear and crisp, crisp, crisp. It picks up extremely well. It also has three directional modes, which all seem to work well. I usually keep it on unidirectional, and sitting a foot or more away from the microphone I get as good of a recording as within a few inches - both being *excellent*.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Lott

customer_reviews.title: good snowball
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this thing or almost 5 years now i think and i still use it till this day. and ive only recently had a problem with one of the mic settings where it sounds horrible so i use it on setting 2 i think. but i think the problem might be on my end not sure. But this is the best mic in my opinion and make sure to buy a mic stand for it to hang in front of you since the stand that comes with it kinda sucks tbh
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Fantasic
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a podcast I do for a libertarian/conservative/humor website. I was finally able to use it and it's amazing. Listening to the podcast after the fact, my voice was clearer than almost everyone else. I cannot speak to music recordings. So if you're buying this to record your music, I'm of no help to you. But if you're using it for podcast or other voice recordings, I cannot recommend it enough. Also, if you buy one of the uglier colors, the price is significantly lower. I figure since no one is going to see me record a podcast then I might as well get one of those and save the money. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Alphonse

customer_reviews.title: Great Mic
customer_reviews.text: Great audio for the price. I actually heard about this mic from a youtube tutorial. I am so glad i bought this one. It is a heavier mic but with the usb type hook up and plug and play it works great. Also the the little tripod stand that it come with is pretty heavy duty. My only dislike which is preference is the outer shell of the mic is plastic. It is thick plastic but still just plastic so you want to make sure it is set up in a safe place where it will not take a big fall.
customer_reviews.author: Jim S.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well, and I couldn't do Zoom/Google/ video calls without it. The older model "on" indicator light is brighter, which I prefer, but that's a small quibble.
customer_reviews.author: GS

product_meta.title: Blue Snowball USB Microphone (Textured White)
product_meta.description: Color:Textured White| Style:Microphone onlyCreate studio-quality recordings with Blue Microphone's Snowball, a USB microphone with exceptional sound-capture capabilities. Using Blue Microphone's award-winning dual-capsule and circuit design, the Snowball produces crisp, clean recordings that are free of feedback and distortion. A unique pattern switch allows you to toggle between three different settings, giving you the flexibility to record vocals, instrumental music, podcasts, interviews, and more. With a plug-and-play design that is both Mac and PC compatible, the Snowball requires no additional drivers and is ready to record straight out of the box.
feature_bullets: Plug and play design — no software required
Professional studio quality performance — record both vocals and instruments
Blue’s renowned circuit and unique two-capsule design
Switchable mic patterns for a variety of recording applications
